name: Coton in the Elms Circular Walk

ai.summary: Coton in the Elms Circular Walk is a short, easy 3.1 km circuit in the UK. The route loops around the village of Coton in the Elms, following quiet lanes and public footpaths. It is a gentle stroll suitable for families and beginners, typically taking about 45-60 minutes at a relaxed pace.
ai.terrain_summary: The surface is a mix of tarmac lanes, gravel paths, and grassy tracks. Expect gentle gradients with a few stiles and gates. In wet weather parts of the route can be muddy, so footwear with good grip is recommended.
ai.safety_notes: Carry a map or device with offline maps, especially if you wander from settled paths. Stay on public rights of way, follow gates and stiles, and close any gates after you. Be mindful of farm animals and local livestock. The weather in the UK can change quickly, so bring waterproofs and sun protection as needed. Tell someone your planned return time if walking alone.
recommended_gear: Map, compass, or offline navigation on a phone
ai.best_seasons: All year round, though spring and autumn offer pleasant colours and milder conditions. In winter be prepared for mud and shorter daylight hours.

seo.title: Coton in the Elms Circular Walk - 3.1 km Easy UK Hike
seo.meta_description: Explore the Coton in the Elms Circular Walk, a gentle 3.1 km circuit in the UK. Perfect for a short, family-friendly countryside stroll on quiet lanes and public footpaths.
